EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The OxyChem facility at Convent, LA is a producer of industrial chemicals.  OxyChem is a wholly owned subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))

OxyChem has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the OxyChem Convent facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the OxyChem Convent facility.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (? 68.155(b))

The OxyChem Convent facility consists of several chemical production units that are wholly owned by OxyChem.  OxyChem operates all units at the site.  The facility handles one substance that is regulated by the RMP rule:             

Chlorine        


The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(d))

The OxyChem Convent facility?s prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information    Process Hazard Analysis    Operating Procedures
Training    Mechanical Integrity    Management of Change
Pre-Startup Review    Compliance Audits    Incident Investigation
Employee Participation    Key Procedures    Contractors

Each of the items listed above are documented and maintained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident

History (? 68.155(e))

There were not any RMP accidents at the OxyChem Convent facility in the past 5 years.

Emergency Response Program (? 68.155(f))

The OxyChem Convent facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (?ERT?) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response time of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plant's Emergency Command Center (?ECC?).  In addition, the OxyChem Convent facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (?SSP?) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporate Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility is a member of the St. James Parish Local Emergency Planning Committee (?LEPC?), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (? 68.155(g))

The OxyChem Convent facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.

Certification Statement

To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
